abstract: Members of American orchestras are finding it more and more difficult to find work on movie soundtracks as such jobs have increasingly been given to foreign orchestras; situation is underscored by Amazon series Mozart in the Jungle, in which real orchestral musicians appearing in some scenes mime playing their instruments to tracks pre-recorded in Slovakia.
lead_paragraph: In a scene in “Mozart in the Jungle,” musicians are portrayed in a studio recording an over-the-top score for a low-budget film, a scene that verges on anachronistic.
snippet: In a scene in “Mozart in the Jungle,” musicians are portrayed in a studio recording an over-the-top score for a low-budget film, a scene that verges on anachronistic.

headline.main: For Musicians, a TV Series Underscores Diminishing Role
headline.print_headline: For Musicians, a TV Series Underscores Diminishing Role
